title: New Retro and Nostalgic Families Released and Discounted
content:
Greater Albion Typefounders has just released out latest two families, [Slatterine](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202214818/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/slatterine/) and [Stannard](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202214818/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/stannard/). Slatterine is a ‘Streamline-era’ family drawing its inspiration from the ‘futuristic’ designs of the 1950s. Stannard is a pure piece of advertising inspired Nostalgia from the 1920s. Starting from November 5 both families will be offered at a 30% discount on myfonts.com.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202214818im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Slatterine_Sale_Poster%20copy_3830.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202214818im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Stannard_Sale_Poster_3662.jpg)
author: Rasendyll

comments.content: We have just posted some examples of Stannard and Slatterine in use on our [blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202214818/http:/gatf.wordpress.com/).

Switching anti-aliasing off when showing type does not look good. In fact it's only partially anti-aliased - why?

Nick Cooke
